channel.title: (help) do i put my no-ip adress in the server side or client side?
channel.description: do i put my no-ip adress in the server side or client side?

item.title: (help) do i put my no-ip adress in the server side or client side?
item.dc:creator: @whitefang1 whitefang1
item.description:
@whitefang1 wrote:

[quote=“Epic Steve, post:9, topic:361344”][quote author=whitefang1 link=topic=457621.msg3349039#msg3349039 date=1285103477]

no problem Enjoy coding

dont worry i will lol

Why do you people think you need to add your IP to your server source? You don’t.

why dont you??
[/quote]
Because the server accepts connections. The client connects to the server and then data is sent bla bla. Why would the server need to hold the the IP address?

Client
|
| Uses given IP address to connect to the server.
| Sends and receives data to/from the server.
V
Server
|

Accepts connections and begins data handling / sending.

The only thing that uses the IP address is the client and that’s to connect to the server.[/quote]

OKAY

Read full topic
item.source: (help) do i put my no-ip adress in the server side or client side?

item.title: (help) do i put my no-ip adress in the server side or client side?
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“whitefang1, post:8, topic:361344”][quote author=Rocky2k10 link=topic=457621.msg3349034#msg3349034 date=1285103188]
no problem Enjoy coding
[/quote]
dont worry i will lol

Why do you people think you need to add your IP to your server source? You don’t.

why dont you?? [/quote]
Because the server accepts connections. The client connects to the server and then data is sent bla bla. Why would the server need to hold the the IP address?

Client
|
| Uses given IP address to connect to the server.
| Sends and receives data to/from the server.
V
Server
|

Accepts connections and begins data handling / sending.

The only thing that uses the IP address is the client and that’s to connect to the server.

Read full topic

item.title: (help) do i put my no-ip adress in the server side or client side?
item.dc:creator: @whitefang1 whitefang1
item.description:
@whitefang1 wrote:

Rocky2k10:

you can change it server sided and keep client sided as “127.0.0.1” and you will still be able to connect.

thanks man

Read full topic

item.source: (help) do i put my no-ip adress in the server side or client side?

item.title: (help) do i put my no-ip adress in the server side or client side?
item.dc:creator: @whitefang1 whitefang1
item.description:
@whitefang1 wrote:

Rocky2k10:

Both, well depends what you need to do is this, add it your source for defo, then for client if you want tohers to connect add your no-ip to it, but on that ip you wont be able to connect you will have to use 127.0.0.1

ok but if i do that would i still be able to login with 127.0.0.1?

Read full topic
